intro: Borreria tenella, commonly known as redroot false cypress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-arid regions. Borreria tenella has small, needle-like leaves and produces red or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. It is used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
